meanings.definition: To repair or replace the sole of a shoe.
meanings.sent1: I resoled my favorite shoes to make them last longer.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler resoled the worn-out boots with a sturdy new sole.
meanings.sent3: After I resoled my sneakers, they felt like brand new.
meanings.sent4: She resoled her shoes with care, like giving them a second chance.
meanings.sent5: The sound of resoled shoes tapping on the pavement was satisfying.

meanings.definition: To provide with a new sole.
meanings.sent1: He resoled the old shoes to make them comfortable again.
meanings.sent2: The shoemaker resoled the sandals for the upcoming summer season.
meanings.sent3: Resoling the shoes felt like giving them a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: The resoled boots felt like walking on clouds.
meanings.sent5: The resoled sneakers had better grip on the slippery floor.

meanings.definition: To mend or fix the sole of a shoe.
meanings.sent1: She resoled her favorite heels to wear them to the party.
meanings.sent2: The repair shop resoled the customer's damaged shoes quickly.
meanings.sent3: Resoling the shoes was a simple task for the skilled cobbler.
meanings.sent4: The resoled boots were ready for another long hike.
meanings.sent5: The resoled loafers looked as good as new after the repair.
